GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1867 as West Virginia Normal School at Fairmont, renamed Fairmont State Normal School in the 1870s, Fairmont State Teachers College 1931, Fairmont State College 1944, acquired current status and title 2004. Merged with Pierpont Community and Technical College 2007

Founded 1991 as American Military University (AMU) to offer education to military personnel and to help military personnel reintegration. Acquired current title in 2002. Earned accreditation status in 1995
AdmissionRequirements: High School Diploma or GED (or equivalent)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1840
Founded 1895 as Bluefield State College, acquired current status and title 2022
Founded 1872 as Concord State Normal School, renamed Concord State Teachers College 1931, became Concord College 1943, acquired current status and title 2004
Founded 1904
Founded 1992 as Future Generations, Inc. by UNICEF, became Future Generations Graduate School in 2006, received full accreditation in 2010, and acquired current title in 2017
Founded 1872 as Glenville Normal School, renamed Glenville State Teachers College 1931, Glenville State College 1943, acquired current status and title 2022
Founded 1837 as Marshall Academy, became Marshall College 1858, acquired present status and title 1961. Merged with West Virginia Graduate College 1997
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1888 as Salem College. In 1989, merged with Teikyo University Foundation, Japan to form Salem-Teikyo University. Became Salem International University in 2000 and acquired current title 2017
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: June to June (June-September; September-December; January-March; April-June)
AdmissionRequirements: High School Diploma or GED (or equivalent); SAT or ACT examination; TOEFL examination for international applicants

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1871 as Shepherd College, acquired current status and title 2004

Divisions.College: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, and Nursing

Address.college_name: Strayer University – Strayer University-Teays Valley Campus

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 2009. A campus of Strayer University, with the main campus located in Washington D.C.
AdmissionRequirements: High School Diploma or GED (or equivalent)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1888 in Barboursville, became Morris Harvey College 1901, moved to Charleston 1935 and to present Campus 1947. Acquired present title 1978
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May. Also Summer Session (May-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1983

Divisions.College: Medical Front Office, Billing and Coding

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1837 as West Liberty Academy, renamed West Liberty State Normal School 1870, West Liberty State Teachers College 1931,West Liberty State College 1943, acquired present title and status 2009

Address.college_name: West Virginia School of Osteopathic Medicine

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1972 as the private Greenbrier College of Osteopathic Medicine, acquired current status and title 1976
AdmissionRequirements: 90 semester hours or three-quarters of credits towards Bachelor from an accredited college or university

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1891
Founded 1867. A State institution with regional campuses
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May (August-December; January-May). Also Summer Sessions (May-June; July-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
TOEFL test for foreign students with a minimum score of 550 for regular admission

Address.college_name: West Virginia University – West Virginia University Institute of Technology

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1895 as Montgomery Preparatory School in Montgomery, became a vocational school renamed the West Virginia Trade School 1917, became a junior college renamed the New River State School 1921, became the West Virginia Institute of Technology 1941, acquired current title 1996 when it became a regional campus of West Virginia University. Became a divisional Campus of West Virginia University (WVU) 2006
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

Address.college_name: West Virginia University – West Virginia University Potomac State College

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1901 as the Keyser Preparatory Branch of the West Virginia University (WVU), initiated academic activities 1902 as West Virginia Preparatory School, fully integrated as a divisional campus of WVU 2005

Founded 1961 as the Parkersburg Branch of West Virginia University (WVU), became Parkersburg Community College 1971, renamed West Virginia University at Parkersburg 1989 and rejoined WVU as a regional campus, an independent institution affiliated with WVU

Divisions.College: Workforce, Technical and Computer Information Science

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1890 as the West Virginia Conference Seminary. Renamed Wesleyan University of West Virginia 1905, acquied curren ttitle 1906. A private institution affiliated with the United Methodist Churches (USA)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1954 as Wheeling College by the Jesuits, renamed Wheeling Jesuit College 1986, Wheeling Jesuit University 1996, acquired current title 2019
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to May (September-December; January-May). Also Summer Sessions (May-July; July-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
